episodes.name: The Southern Mansion – New Jersey
episodes.overview: Perched on the southern most tip of New Jersey the southern mansion dates back from 1863. Originally a seaside palace which was the summer estate used by rich industrialist George Allen and his family for 83 years. Now although a high class, glorious Bed and Breakfast, the southern mansion still has a few residents from its past hanging around to surprise some unsuspecting guests.

episodes.name: Madame Tussauds
episodes.overview: London is the destination for Yvette Fielding and the Most Haunted team where fear, dread and eerie dopple-gangers await in the most famous tourist attraction in the world. The attraction has a long and diverse history beginning life in France in the 1700’s – Marie Tussaud, nee Grosholtz, learnt her wax modelling arts from Dr Philippe Curtius, a physician and skilled wax modeller, for whom her mother was housekeeper. On his death, he left his waxwork collection to Marie. By 1835 she was established in London. “The Chamber of Horrors” became one of the first and most popular attractions. Despite success, Madame Tussaud, gained a reputation for being unsmiling and penny-inching. She died in 1850, but her legacy lived on via her sons. The business continued to prosper and by 1884, her grandsons had moved the exhibit to its current location on Marylebone Road. The stories of paranormal occurrences that cling to the attraction and its many exhibits were reason enough for Most Haunted to come and investigate

episodes.name: The Conference House – Staten Island
episodes.overview: The Conference House, or Billop house as it is sometimes known, is a colonial mansion on Staten Island, New York. It is historically significant because a peace conference was held here in an attempt to stop the Revolutionary War. The investigation team held a large group séance in the kitchen basement of the house and the results were amazing.

episodes.name: Wookey Hole
episodes.overview: Somerset plays host to Yvette Fielding and the Most Haunted team as they visit Wookey Hole where as the story goes, a witch was turned into stone. The clashing of cymbals and ancient pagan rituals await. The spectacular series of caverns, 25 of which form the wonderful family visitor attraction, were formed over millions of years by what is now the River Axe which runs out of Wookey Hole and past the Mill, giving rise to the local belief that it flows from deep within the Underworld. They have seen human habitation for over 50,000 years and around 200AD, the Greek diarist Clement of Alexandria described hearing sounds like the “clashing of numerous cymbals” coming from the caves. The Mill has its own share of supernatural apparitions which convinced the Most Haunted team that an investigation of Wookey hole and its surroundings was long overdue.

episodes.name: The Stanley Hotel
episodes.overview: Yvette Fielding and the team visit the Stanley Hotel in Colorado, which inspired horror author Stephen King's novel The Shining and has a sinister reputation

episodes.name: Waverly Hills Sanatorium
episodes.overview: The team travel to Kentucky to explore Waverly Hills Sanatorium, already popularised on television as being the one of the most haunted hospitals in Eastern USA

episodes.name: West Virginia State Penitentiary
episodes.overview: Yvette Fielding and the team visit the West Virginia State Penitentiary, a site with a dark history and the subject of a number of sinister stories involving violent inmates

episodes.name: Sleepy Hollow
episodes.overview: The team visit Sleepy Hollow, a village in the town of Mount Pleasant in New York, which is the setting of the famous Washington Irving ghost story, The Legend of Sleepy Hollow, inspired by pre-revolutionary folklore of a headless horseman

episodes.name: New London Ledge Light House
episodes.overview: Yvette Fielding and the team hunt for paranormal activity at the New London Ledge Light House in Connecticut

episodes.name: Fort Delaware
episodes.overview: Yvette Fielding and the team hunt for ghosts at Fort Delaware, a former prison that housed thousands of inmates, and record a sample of possible Electronic Voice Phenomena

episodes.name: The Southern Mansion
episodes.overview: Yvette Fielding and the team of investigators visit a New Jersey mansion that now operates as a bed and breakfast, in search of paranormal activity

episodes.name: Conference House
episodes.overview: Yvette Fielding and the team visit the Conference House on Staten Island, New York, and the mansion provides a number of shocks during the course of their investigation

episodes.name: Speke Hall
episodes.overview: Yvette and the paranormal team travel to Speke Hall in Liverpool to try and capture any paranormal activity happening there.

episodes.name: Inveraray Jail
episodes.overview: Built in 1820 the site was home to both a jail and courthouse serving all of Argyll. Over 6000 men women and children were tried and held in the prison where convict’s shared just eight cells with vagrants and the insane. Now used as a museum, visitors have reported many ghostly incidents in the cells including whispering, clanking chains and dark figures cowering in the shadows. The Most Haunted team have one night to investigate these stories, but who will visit them during the late night vigils.

episodes.name: Layer Marney Tower
episodes.overview: The team travel to Essex tonight and venture into the Tudor gatehouse in search of it's former residents.Construction was started by Henry 1st Lord Marney.When he died in 1523, however, his son John carried on his work making Layer Marney Tower one of the grandest buildings of it's time.

episodes.name: Toxteth's Gaumont Cinema
episodes.overview: Yvette Fielding and a team of investigators visit Gaumont Cinema in Toxteth, Liverpool, where sightings of mysterious lights and ghostly figures have been reported.

episodes.name: Inveraray Castle, Scotland
episodes.overview: Yvette Fielding and a team of investigators visit Inverary Castle in Scotland, which is allegedly host to musical echoes and ghostly figures.

episodes.name: Kelvedon Nuclear Bunker
episodes.overview: Yvette Fielding and the team visit a nuclear bunker in Brentwood, Essex, to conduct a paranormal investigation.

episodes.name: Tolbooth Museum
episodes.overview: Yvette and the team take a look around the 14th-century tollbooth museum as they look for paranormal activity.

episodes.name: Cromer Pier
episodes.overview: Yvette Fielding and the team visit Cromer Pier in Norfolk, where reports of ghostly activity include men in medieval rags and restless boatmen roaming the shore line.

episodes.name: Castle Fraser
episodes.overview: Yvette Fielding and the team visit a Scottish castle with a history dating back to the 12th century, where sightings of long-dead prisoners and a ghostly princess have been reported.

episodes.name: Edward Jenner Museum
episodes.overview: Yvette Fielding and a team of investigators visit the 18th-century home of Edward Jenner, whose research led to the eradication of smallpox.

episodes.name: Berkeley Castle
episodes.overview: The current incarnation of the castle was built in 1153 AD, and used as a shell keep.It played a part in two historical events - housing West Country barons while they were on their way to fight King John in Runnymead, before the Magna Carta was signed, and, perhaps more well known, for the incarceration of Edward II, who was deposed by his Queen, Isabella, and her lover Roger Mortimer.The King was tortured, and died an agonising death.His screams, according to legend, can still be heard each year on the anniversary of his passing.

episodes.name: Kiplin Hall
episodes.overview: Yvette Fielding and a team of investigators visit Kiplin Hall, a 17th-century building in North Yorkshire said to house the chopping block used in the beheading of Charles I

episodes.name: Carlisle Castle
episodes.overview: Tonight the team head to the English/Scottish border and Carlisle Castle.Most famous for having Mary Queen of Scots imprisoned within it's walls in 1568, the castle switched hands between the English and Scottish many times over it's long history.Once used as a prison and barracks for the military, it still houses, to this day, the headquarters of a Royal Regiment. One of the many ghosts said to haunt the building is that of a woman found bricked up in a wall.Her skeleton was discovered on the second floor of the keep in the 1830's, and her presence is said to have caused one soldier to die of fright. What will the Most Haunted team uncover?

episodes.name: Brinkburn Priory
episodes.overview: Yvette Fielding and a team of investigators search for paranormal activity at Brinkburn Priory in Northumberland, apparently host to the spirits of the monks who died there

episodes.name: Verdley Woods
episodes.overview: Verdley Woods is known as being the highest hill in Sussex, standing at a mighty 919 feet. It is situated to the north east of the village of Fernhurst, and is said to be haunted by the last bear ever to be killed in England. Will the team encounter the ghostly animal?

episodes.name: Maesmawr Hall
episodes.overview: Yvette Fielding and a team of investigators visit historical Tudor mansion Maesmawr Hall in Powys, a 17th-century hall where the spirit of a white horse has apparently been spotted in nearby fields

episodes.name: Belsay Hall
episodes.overview: Building work on Belsay Hall, Northumberland, began exactly one hundred years ago, in 1810, taking 7 years to complete. It was the brainchild of Sir Charles Monck, and designed by architect John Dobson. Today it is just an empty shell, and the only work that is done to it is purely structural, but downstairs the remains of the Greek style pillars can still be seen. With it's servants quarters and nursery in the attic, all said to be haunted, will the team come across the resident spirits?

episodes.name: Gregynog Hall
episodes.overview: Gregynog Hall is situated in Powys, mid-Wales, and has been passed through many hands throughout the years. The current building, made entirely of concrete, but with mock Tudor wooden beams on the outer walls, was built in the 1840's by Charles Hanbury-Tracy.Once used by the Davies sisters, Margaret and Gwendoline, as a rehabilitation house during the war, they handed it over to the University of Wales in 1963, who now use it as a conference and study centre for their students.But with a strong history of paranormal activity, will the Most Haunted team be able to uncover it's secrets?

episodes.name: Weald and Downland Night 1
episodes.overview: Part one of two. Yvette Fielding and a team of investigators begin their examination of the 50 crumbling buildings preserved at the Open Air Museum in Chichester, West Sussex

episodes.name: Weald and Downland Night 2
episodes.overview: Part two of two. Yvette Fielding and the team return to a historical village that is allegedly home to a mysterious, dark figure

episodes.name: The Royal Court Theatre
episodes.overview: The world famous ghost hunting team return for a new series and start in a small theatre with a big problem...ghosts. Once an iron foundry this theatre has stood since 1893 and is said to house so much activity that the theatre’s director asked Most Haunted for help. In a night of sheer fright with poltergeist activity, ghostly footsteps abound and scare after scare, will the team make it through the night?

episodes.name: Newton House (Part 1) (with Bullet for My Valentine)
episodes.overview: The first of a two-part investigation with celebrity guests, world famous band ‘Bullet for My Valentine’. An old house said to be built on cursed land and filled with evil meet the team in this spine-chilling episode. The band have their beliefs changed as they experience the full force of a house that just doesn’t seem to want them there. One of the team succumbs to the horror of the house, a poltergeist takes a dislike to some and a wheelchair gives some of most compelling evidence yet.

episodes.name: Newton House (Part 2) (with Bullet for My Valentine)
episodes.overview: Part 2 of this spine-chilling investigation. Nursing their wounds from the last episode the team and their celebrity guests ‘Bullet For My Valentine’ carry on. They investigate deeper into the abyss of the paranormal but none of them are quite prepared for what happens.

episodes.name: The Galleries of Justice
episodes.overview: The legendary ghost hunters continue in Nottingham and a place where people could be jailed, sentenced and executed without even leaving the building, no wonder it is said to be one of the most haunted places in Great Britain. The team are tested as a mysterious poltergeist takes a dislike to Karl and Stuart, while Yvette is faced with being followed by a foul smelling spirit and experiences her most compelling evidence yet.

episodes.name: Delapré Abbey (with the England Rugby Team)
episodes.overview: The team are joined by five members of the English rugby team as they investigate an all but forgotten piece of British history. With spooks galore and spirits abound the whole investigation takes a new turn when one of the Rugby team is given some information on a ouija board that he will never forget and a poltergiest takes a dislike to the rest of team.

episodes.name: The National Emergency Services Museum
episodes.overview: A terrifying place full of history and paranormal activity. The team are tested as the try to find the spirits that refuse to leave this famous location. For one crew member the experience proves too much, while the others are tested to the extreme.

episodes.name: Ye Olde Kings Head
episodes.overview: The Great British pub may be on the decline but in some paranormal activity seems to be on the rise and the Ye Olde Kings Head is one of the most haunted. Plagued with a variety of different strange happenings the owners are at their wits end and call in the Most Haunted team. With poltergeist activity abound the Olde Kings Head is a worthy opponent.

episodes.name: Drakelow Tunnels
episodes.overview: With over 4 miles of haunted tunnels the team have one night to investigate this labyrinth of horror. Alone in the dark with no chance of escape until the night is completed the team are faced with countless spirits that refuse to leave, a lost soul that lurks in the shadows waiting to jump out at any unsuspecting visitor and a particularly nasty poltergeist that is said to be very unhappy with anyone entering its space.

episodes.name: Saltmarshe Hall (Part 1)
episodes.overview: Saltmarshe Hall is a mysterious, haunted house of complete contrasts. Beneath the property lies a network of corridors and cellar rooms and the abandoned North Wing has sat empty for over 70 years, apart from the ghosts said to wander the corridors and rooms. The team uncover another level of the house that even the present owners have never ventured and what they find will frighten them beyond belief.

episodes.name: Saltmarshe Hall (Part 2)
episodes.overview: Saltmarshe Hall is a mysterious, haunted house of complete contrasts. Beneath the property lies a network of corridors and cellar rooms and the abandoned North Wing has sat empty for over 70 years, apart from the ghosts said to wander the corridors and rooms. The team uncover another level of the house that even the present owners have never ventured and what they find will frighten them beyond belief.

episodes.name: The Tivoli Venue
episodes.overview: The team take their ghost-hunting gall to the Tivoli Venue in Wales. Will the spectre of a film projectionist spook them?

episodes.name: Tatton Old Hall
episodes.overview: The team return to 15th century Tatton Old Hall in Cheshire to tackle growling ghouls, dangerous demons and mysterious messages.

episodes.name: Annison Funeral Parlour
episodes.overview: Yvette and the team take a look around a freaky funeral parlour where whistling, knocking and ghostly footsteps are common place.

episodes.name: Fort Paull (Part 1)
episodes.overview: The team head to Fort Paull in Kingston-Upon-Hull where they face terror in a train carriage and Yvette gets the shakes!

episodes.name: Fort Paull (Part 2)
episodes.overview: There's more creeping around Fort Paull as the team face some menacing mannequins. But what awaits them in the tunnels?

episodes.name: Wentworth Woodhouse (Part 1)
episodes.overview: There's spine-chilling singing and a headless spook awaiting the team at Wentworth Woodhouse!

episodes.name: Wentworth Woodhouse (Part 2)
episodes.overview: There's subterranean spookiness as the team take to the tunnels for more ghost-hunting at Wentworth Woodhouse.

episodes.name: Oakwell Hall
episodes.overview: The team set out to discover the secrets of 17th century Oakwell House, but encounter unwelcome surprises along the way!

episodes.name: Knottingley Town Hall
episodes.overview: The team endure a night of 'life-changing' experiments and freaky footsteps at former monastery, Knottingley Town Hall.

episodes.name: Capesthorne Hall
episodes.overview: Floating disembodied limbs have reportedly been spotted at creepy Capesthorne Hall. Will this vigil spook a sceptic?

episodes.name: 30 East Drive (Part 1)
episodes.overview: A supremely savage spook is said to reside at 30 East Drive in Yorkshire. Will the team receive a wicked welcome?

episodes.name: 30 East Drive (Part 2)
episodes.overview: Things get physical as the team continue to investigate Yorkshire's 30 East Drive, home to The Black Monk of Pontefract.

episodes.name: Thackray Museum
episodes.overview: The team might need a little TLC after their visit to a Leeds medical museum, where a spirit doctor is doing his rounds.

episodes.name: Armley Mills
episodes.overview: The team sift for spooky secrets at the Armely Mills museum in Leeds, where spirits of its industrial past are said to linger.

episodes.name: Carr House
episodes.overview: Will a resident grey lady drain the colour from the team's faces at Carr House? Will a headless jester play a nasty trick?

episodes.name: Hill House (Part 1)
episodes.overview: The dark corridors of Cheshire's Hill house reveal a spirit who is desperate to make contact with the terrified team.

episodes.name: Hill House (Part 2)
episodes.overview: Things take a chilling turn at Hill House as one of the team become trapped, while another is knocked off their feet!

episodes.name: Village Church Farm House
episodes.overview: The team creep around a cluster of old buildings in Skegness, where moving objects lurk around dark corners and spooky sounds fill the halls.

episodes.name: The Old Nick Theatre
episodes.overview: The team face a night of mysterious moving objects at the Old Nick Theatre, where one spirit is desperate to hog the spotlight.

episodes.name: Black Country Museum
episodes.overview: The team head to a living museum in Dudley, where a spook wants to chat via the Ouija board and EVP machine.

episodes.name: Lyceum Theatre
episodes.overview: Yvette Fielding and her team of paranormal experts head to the Lyceum Theatre in Crewe, Cheshire, which is known for its paranormal activity. They take the fight right to phantoms that lurk in the theatre's darkness with some truly frightening consequences.

episodes.name: Whittington Castle
episodes.overview: The team encouter the ghost of a drowned soldier at the once magnificent Whittington Castle in Shropshire.

episodes.name: Halsham House
episodes.overview: A poltergeist awaits the team at Halsham House, and there's a creepy discovery in the attic

episodes.name: Mansion House
episodes.overview: Strange goings-on have been reported by staff and guests at the Mansion House care home.

episodes.name: Walton Hall
episodes.overview: The team are at Walton Hall in Cheshire where they encounter a disembodied voice, and Yvette gets spooked in the cellar.

episodes.name: Oak House
episodes.overview: Oak House is thought to be one of the most haunted places in West Bromwich. One experience changes the belief of sceptic Glen.

episodes.name: Middleton Hall
episodes.overview: Grade II listed Middleton Hall has a history of paranormal activity. Yvette sees something that shocks her to the core.

episodes.name: HM Prison Shrewsbury (1)
episodes.overview: Yvette Fielding and the ghost hunting team take on their biggest challenge yet at HM Prison Shrewsbury. First up is the 'A' Wing where something seems to be stalking them.

episodes.name: HM Prison Shrewsbury (2)
episodes.overview: Yvette and the rest of the ghost-hunting team continue their mammoth search of HM Prison Shrewsbury. What will be waiting for them in the former execution room?

episodes.name: HMP Shrewsbury (3)
episodes.overview: Yvette and the team conclude their spooky search at HMP Shrewsbury. Yvette gets the biggest shock of her career, while sceptic Glen sees something he can't explain.

episodes.name: Abbey House Museum
episodes.overview: Spook-searching with Yvette and co! The newest member of the team, Watson the bulldog, joins in the investigations at Abbey House Museum in Leeds.

episodes.name: Wentworth Woodhouse Stables
episodes.overview: Yvette and the team search for more things that go bump in the night! The team may just have filmed some of their best evidence ever at Wentworth Woodhouse Stables in Yorkshire.

episodes.name: The Slaughter House
episodes.overview: Ghostly goings-on with Yvette Fielding. The team get more than they bargained for when they pay a visit to the Liverpool's oldest pub, The Slaughterhouse.

episodes.name: Todmorden Unitarian Church
episodes.overview: More creepy capers with Yvette and the fearless Most Haunted team. The team find they are not alone when they go into the cellar of Todmoreden Church in West Yorkshire.

episodes.name: Weir Mill
episodes.overview: Spine-tingling snooping with Yvette Fielding. An evening at the abandoned Weir Mill in Stockport proves too much for one team member who makes an early exit.

episodes.name: Ripon Union Workhouse
episodes.overview: Hunting the haunted with Yvette Fielding! The Ripon Workhouse in Yorkshire is said to be teeming with undead souls, one of which seems to be following the team around...

episodes.name: Old Prison
episodes.overview: Spook searching with Yvette and co. The team attempt to stay the night at the old prison in Ripon where they have some lingering former inmates for company.

episodes.name: Standon Hall (Part 1)
episodes.overview: More paranormal sleuthing with Yvette Fielding. A fearful team begin their three-part investigation of the mysterious Standon Hall in Staffordshire.

episodes.name: Standon Hall (Part 2)
episodes.overview: Spooky series with Yvette Fielding. The team continue their mammoth investigation of Standon Hall. Yvette has some harsh words for Karl when he takes a dangerous risk.

episodes.name: Standon Hall (Part 3)
episodes.overview: Ghostly goings-on with Yvette Fielding. In the final part of the team's scariest search to date, something in Standon Hall lets the team know they have outstayed their welcome.

episodes.name: Rowley's House
episodes.overview: Spook-searching with Yvette and co! The team heads to the centre of Shrewsbury where a house is said to be full of the long dead just wanting to make themselves known.

episodes.name: The Fleece Inn
episodes.overview: Spook-searching with Yvette and co! In West Yorkshire, the team encounters violent poltergeist activity at The Fleece Inn pub, said to be one of the most haunted places in England.

episodes.name: Haden Hill House (Part 1)
episodes.overview: Spook-searching with Yvette and co! The team experiences a fraught night at an old house in the West Midlands as Yvette comes under attack by something that wants her attention.

episodes.name: Haden Hill House (Part 2)
episodes.overview: Spook-searching with Yvette and co! The strange occurrences at Hayden Hill House switch up a gear as whatever is there seems to be stalking the team with some terrifying results.

episodes.name: Croxteth Hall (Part 1) ('As' Live Special)
episodes.overview: Spook-searching with Yvette and co! In a non-stop, two-hour heart-pounding investigation at Liverpool's Croxteth Hall, the team is pushed to the limit.

episodes.name: Croxteth Hall (Part 2)
episodes.overview: Spook-searching with Yvette and co! Still at Croxteth Hall, the team seems to be stalked by something strange. Only time will tell what awaits them in the upper corridors.

episodes.name: The Old House
episodes.overview: Spook-searching with Yvette and co! The team visits a house in Coalville that is surrounded by mystery. There they seem to disturb the rest of some of its long-term residents.

episodes.name: The Keighley Bus Museum
episodes.overview: Spook-searching with Yvette and co! At Keithley Bus Museum, the team notices vehicles moving on their own, strange footsteps and something which seems to take a disliking to them.

episodes.name: The Judges' Lodgings (Part 1)
episodes.overview: Spook-searching with Yvette and co! The team head to Presteigne in Wales and the famous Judge's Lodgings where they are put through their paces by an unseen spirit.

episodes.name: The Judges' Lodgings (Part 2)
episodes.overview: Spook-searching with Yvette and co! The investigation continues into the Judge's Lodgings where the team seems to be under attack, and something is trying to get through a door.

episodes.name: Birmingham Central Lockup
episodes.overview: Spook-searching with Yvette and co! A wailing woman seems to want to make contact with the team at a disused prison in Birmingham which has housed some notorious criminals.

episodes.name: The Union Workhouse (Part 1)
episodes.overview: Spook-searching with Yvette and co!. Yvette and the team are pushed to the limits on a memorable visit to Llanfyllin workhouse to discover why anyone would stay after they had died.

episodes.name: The Union Workhouse (Part 2)
episodes.overview: Spook-searching with Yvette and co! Whatever was making itself known to the team at Llanfyllin workhouse is still evident as something seems to be following Yvette from the shadows.

episodes.name: Beaumanor Hall (Part 1)
episodes.overview: Spook-searching with Yvette and co! Yvette is pushed to the limits in a haunted disused attic at stately home Beaumanor Hall, and Karl is followed by a very heavily booted phantom.

episodes.name: Beaumanor Hall (Part 2)
episodes.overview: Spook-searching with Yvette and co! Still in Beaumanor Hall, Yvette and her team venture into the abyss of the cellars where the darkness suddenly seems to come to life.

episodes.name: Dudley Castle
episodes.overview: Spook-searching with Yvette and co! The ruins of Dudley Castle house a plethora of paranormal activity. Strange noises and a violent poltergeist await Yvette and her team.

episodes.name: Codnor Castle Cottage (Part 1)
episodes.overview: Spook-searching with Yvette and co! The team visits Codnor Castle which has a dark history of cursed dolls, murder and suicide. Strange occurrences scare them to breaking point.

episodes.name: Codnor Castle Cottage (Part 2)
episodes.overview: Yvette Fielding and the Most Haunted team wrap up their investigate of the farmhouse in the ground of Codnor Castle in Derbyshire.

episodes.name: Moat House (Part 1)
episodes.overview: The first half of Most Haunted's investigation of a Grade II historic public house in Staffordshire, England, located in what were once the grounds of Tamworth Castle.

episodes.name: Moat House (Part 2)
episodes.overview: The conclusion of Yvette Fielding and her team's investigation of an iconic property located in the heart of Tamworth, which has been renovated into a spacious bar, lounge and restaurant.
